sourcesContent:
import React, { useState } from 'react'; import './BonusBridgeExplanation.css'; /** * Component to explain Bonus Bridge scoring system * @param {Object} props - Component props * @param {Function} props.onClose - Function to close the explanation */ const BonusBridgeExplanation = ({ onClose }) => { // State for active tab const [activeTab, setActiveTab] = useState('overview'); // Change active tab const handleTabChange = (tab) => { setActiveTab(tab); }; return (

Bonus Bridge Scoring System

{/* Overview Tab */} {activeTab === 'overview' && (

What is Bonus Bridge?

Bonus Bridge is an enhanced scoring system designed to reward both declarers and defenders based on the strength of their hands and their performance relative to expectations.

Key Features

  • HCP Balance Analysis: Evaluates the distribution of high card points (HCP) between declarer and defenders
  • Expected vs. Actual Performance: Compares the number of tricks you should make based on your hand versus what you actually achieved
  • Contract Ambition Factors: Rewards ambitious contracts that succeed and penalizes overly cautious bidding with strong hands
  • Distribution Points: Includes bonuses for shapely hands with singletons, voids, and long suits

How It Works

After a contract is played, enter the high card points and distribution for both declarer/dummy and defenders. The system calculates an expected number of tricks and compares it to the actual result, rewarding skillful play or penalizing poor performance.

The final score is calculated by adjusting the base bridge score with bonuses or penalties based on hand strength, performance variance, and contract ambition.

)} {/* HCP & Distribution Tab */} {activeTab === 'hcp' && (

High Card Points (HCP)

The standard HCP valuation is used: Ace=4, King=3, Queen=2, Jack=1.

Expected HCP for Contracts

Different contract levels have different HCP expectations:

Contract Level Expected HCP (Declarer + Dummy)
1-level 20-22
2-level 23-24
3-level 25-26
4-level 27-28
5-level 29-30
6-level (small slam) 31-35
7-level (grand slam) 36+

HCP Balance Impact

The HCP balance between declarer/dummy and defenders affects scoring:

  • HCP Advantage: When declarer has more than 50% of the total HCP, expectations are higher, and performance bonuses are reduced
  • HCP Disadvantage: When declarer has less than 50% of the total HCP, making the contract is more impressive and earns larger bonuses

Distribution Points

Additional points are awarded for distributional features:

  • Singleton: 1 point
  • Void: 3 points
  • Long suit (6+ cards): 1 point per card over 4

Distribution impacts expected tricks calculation and can provide a bonus to the final score if distribution significantly helps make the contract.

)} {/* Performance Tab */} {activeTab === 'performance' && (

Expected Tricks Formula

The expected number of tricks is calculated using:

Expected Tricks = 6 + (HCP / 3) + (Distribution Points / 4)

Performance Variance

Performance variance is the difference between actual tricks taken and expected tricks:

  • Positive Variance (Over-performance): Taking more tricks than expected
    • Declarer: +10 points per trick over expected
    • Additional bonuses for over-performing with HCP disadvantage
  • Negative Variance (Under-performance): Taking fewer tricks than expected
    • Declarer: -8 points per trick under expected
    • Defenders: +8 points per trick declarer is under expected

Contract Ambition Factor

Optimal contract level is calculated based on declarer's HCP:

Optimal Level = floor((declarer HCP - 20) / 3) + 1

Contract ambition adjustments:

  • Underbidding: -10 × (optimal - actual) when HCP ≥ 25
  • Overbidding: +8 × (actual - optimal) if contract is made

Defender Rewards

Defenders are rewarded in two main scenarios:

  • Defeating Contracts: Larger rewards for defeating contracts when defenders have an HCP disadvantage
  • Limiting Overtricks: Modest rewards when declarer makes the contract but takes fewer tricks than expected based on HCP
)} {/* Examples Tab */} {activeTab === 'examples' && (

Example 1: Made Contract with HCP Advantage

Contract: 4♠ by North

Declarer HCP: 28 (70% of total)

Actual Result: Made exactly (10 tricks)

Expected Tricks: 11.3

Base Score: 420 / 20 = 21.0 points

HCP Adjustment: -2.0 (high HCP advantage)

Performance Variance: -1.3 tricks

Performance Adjustment: -10.4 points

Final Bonus Score: 8.6 points to North-South

Example 2: Failed Contract with HCP Disadvantage

Contract: 3NT by East

Declarer HCP: 18 (45% of total)

Actual Result: Down 1 (8 tricks)

Expected Tricks: 8.5

Base Penalty: 7.5 points to defenders

Level Penalty: 5.0 (for attempting 3NT)

Performance Adjustment: -1.5 (close to expected)

Consolation Points: 3.0 (HCP disadvantage)

Final Bonus Score: 11.0 points to North-South, 3.0 to East-West

Example 3: Made Contract with Overtricks

Contract: 2♥ by South

Declarer HCP: 23 (57.5% of total)

Distribution: 2 singletons (2 points)

Actual Result: Made +2 (10 tricks)

Expected Tricks: 9.2

Base Score: 110 / 20 = 5.5 points

HCP Adjustment: -0.7 (modest advantage)

Performance Variance: +0.8 tricks

Performance Adjustment: +8.0 points

Distribution Bonus: +1.5 points

Contract Ambition: -5.0 (underbid with 23 HCP)

Final Bonus Score: 9.3 points to North-South

)}
); }; export default BonusBridgeExplanation;
